title: packages.yaml versions only used if they exist.
body:
@tgamblin 

Suppose I'm going to build (or have built) a package manually using the `spack setup` stuff.  Typically when I do that, I invent a fake version, I like to use `@local`.  (Unlike `@develop`, Spack does absolutely nothing special with `@local`).  These fake versions are not being picked up from `packages.yaml`.  Witness:

Good:
```
$ spack spec libxml2
libxml2@2.9.4%gcc@4.9.3~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^xz@5.2.2%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
```

Now I want to setup libxml2 for manually compile... Good:
```
$ spack spec libxml2@local
libxml2@local%gcc@4.9.3~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^xz@5.2.2%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
```

Suppose I want to set up libxml2 and xz for manual compile:  Good:
```
$ spack spec libxml2@local ^xz@local
libxml2@local%gcc@4.9.3~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^xz@local%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
```

But... suppose I put the following in my `packages.yaml`:
```
packages:
    xz:
        version: [local]
```

This is not picked up, and I get the same as if it were not there:
```
$ spack spec libxml2@local
libxml2@local%gcc@4.9.3~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^xz@5.2.2%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
```
